q: President Bush at a Feb. 3, 2003 National Security Council meeting in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the U.N. two days later. Donald Rumsfeld quotes himself as having told the meeting, We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as "Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal." Donald Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam

an occupying power. Paul Bremer 's decision to disband the Iraqi army flooded the streets with angry, jobless young men, some of whom would later join the insurgency. But "in truth," Donald Rumsfeld writes, it wasn't all Paul Bremer 's fault... I was told of Paul Bremer 's decision and possibly could have stopped it. And there was a major clash with Condoleezza Rice , Bush's national security adviser.
